title: Student Worker
responsibilities: While working for TAMU-SA Information Technology Services I carried out the following duties:
Editing and creating pages on the University website in Cascade CMS.
Correspondence with faculty and staff regarding their webpages.
Working with checking and fixing broken links on the University website, using SiteImprove.
Additionally, I aided in the creation and maintenance of a new web application for the University in our compliance with HB 2504. This application was created using the following technologies:
A semi-traditional LAMP stack, though I cannot go into specifics due to the nature of the application.
HTML, CSS (mainly Bootstrap, but there was some custom styling), and JavaScript
This application provides the following functionality:
A public-facing page that allows users to search for courses and view their syllabi, as well as to view the biography and CV of a staff / faculty member.

A private-facing page that allows faculty to upload their syllabi and course information, as well as to edit their biography and CV. Biography editing is done in a WYSIWYG editor, and CVs are PDF files that are uploaded to the server.
